p: Clove oil is an extremely important substance which inhibits the growth of the bacteria (e.g., Escherichia coli, Bacillus subtilis), probably thanks to the presence of eugenol, eugenol acetate, and caryophyllene [ 15, 16], and so is oregano oil, perhaps due to the presence of carvacrol [ 17, 18]. On the other hand, α- and β-pinene present in juniper and marjoram oil and, additionally, limonene in marjoram oil may be responsible for the anti-viral, anti-fungal, and antibacterial properties [ 19, 20, 21, 22].
